intro: Oenothera stubbei, commonly known as the stubby evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate and linear, while its stems are often hairy and branching. Oenothera stubbei is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
